Title: c-ares: Heap-based buffer overflow
Synopsis:
A heap-based buffer overflow in c-ares might allow remote attackers
    to cause a Denial of Service condition.

Background.Text: c-ares is a C library for asynchronous DNS requests (including name resolves).

Description.Text: A hostname with an escaped trailing dot (such as “hello\.”) would have its size calculated incorrectly leading to a single byte written beyond the end of a buffer on the heap.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker, able to provide a specially crafted hostname to an application using c-ares, could potentially cause a Denial of Service condition.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All c-ares users should upgrade to the latest version:
